'''Unbreaking''' is an [[enchantment]] that gives a chance for an item to avoid [[durability]] reduction when it is used, effectively increasing the item's durability.

[[File:Unbreaking Enchantment Tool Negative Binomial.png|alt=Unbreaking Enchantment Tool Negative Binomial Graph|thumb|200px|The probability of a tool breaking after a number of uses with different levels of this enchantment. Some lower durability materials may last longer than higher durability materials with some enchantment levels.]]

== Obtaining ==
Unbreaking can be obtained from [[enchanting table]]s, drops from mobs that have spawned in a [[raid]],{{only|bedrock}} books obtained by [[fishing]], [[monster room]] chests, [[librarian]] [[villager]]s, and non-village [[structure]] loot.

== Usage ==
For [[tool]]s and [[weapon]]s, there is a 100%÷(level+1) chance that using the item reduces durability, which means that the item has a 50%/66.66……%/75% chance of not using any durability. On average, tools last 2/3/4 times as long.

For [[armor]]s, there is a 60%+40%÷(level+1) chance a use reduces durability, meaning each durability hit against Unbreaking armor has a 20%/26.66……%/30% chance of being ignored. On average, armor lasts 1.25/1.3636……/1.428571428571…… times as long. Technically, only level below 0 of Unbreaking can lower the reduce-durability chance less than 60%.

When durability is reduced by multiple points, for example,  when hooking a mob with [[fishing rod]]s or getting blown up with [[TNT]], Unbreaking is applied for each point of decision of actual reduction.
